contextId.information: This refers either to 1) Hannah being unable to become pregnant or 2) the way Peninnah always insulted her. The abstract noun "affliction" can be translated as a verb phrase. AT: "how I am suffering because I cannot become pregnant" or "how that woman is afflicting me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

This is another way of saying that she has a "sorrowful spirit," as in 1:15. The abstract nouns "abundance," "concern," and "provocation" can be translated as adjectives and verbs. AT: "I have been speaking because I am very sad, and my rival has greatly provoked me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: I have been speaking out of the abundance of my great concern and provocation

contextId.information: The abstract noun "kingship" can be translated as a clause. AT: "what things that the king would force them to do, and all the things the king was required to do" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: the customs and rules of kingship

contextId.information: The abstract noun "panic" can be stated as the adjective "very afraid." AT: "The Philistine soldiers in the camp and in the field and all the people with them became very afraid" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: There was a panic in the camp, in the field, and among the people

contextId.information: These abstract nouns can be stated as actions. AT: "to rebel is as sinful as doing sorcery" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: rebellion is like the sin of divination

contextId.information: This can be expressed with the verb "disgrace." AT: "stops Israel from being disgraced" or "stops him from disgracing Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: takes away the disgrace from Israel

contextId.information: "I desire that you may live in prosperity." The abstract noun "prosperity" can be translated as a verb. AT: "I desire that you possess many good things as long as you live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "action" can be translated as a verb. AT: "has done to Nabal what Nabal planned to do to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: has turned Nabal's evil action back on his own head

contextId.information: The abstract noun "direction" can be translated as a clause. AT: "David prayed that Yahweh would tell David what David should do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: David prayed to Yahweh for direction
